type.models: Skorne non-character Cyclops and Titan warbeasts

benefits.ingameeffect: Additionally, models in this army gain Pathfinder during your first turn of the game.
Cataphract Arcuarii units gain Advance Deployment
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.
Additionally, you gain +1 on your starting roll for the game.
Models/units in the army gain Stealth during the first round of the game.
For each Paingiver Bloodrunner Master Tormentor solo in the army, one warbeast in Morghoul's battlegroup gains Advance Deployment

tiers.name: Makeda - Army of the Western Reaches

type.models: Cataphract Cetrati, Paingiver Beast Handlers, Tyrant Commander & Standard Bearer, Praetorian units, Venator units
Cataphract solos, Praetorian solos, Saxon Orrik

benefits.ingameeffect: Tyrant Commander & Standard Bearer and Cataphract units in the army gain Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.

type.models: Skorne non-character Cyclops warbeasts, Molik Karn
Paingiver Beast Handlers, Tyrant Commander & Standard Bearer, Praetorian units
Ancestral Guardian solos, Extoller solos, Praetorian solos, Orin Midwinter, Tyrant Rhadeim

benefits.ingameeffect: Place Tyrant Rhadeim and Praetorian Ferox units after normal deployment. These models are placed at the same time as your models with Advance Deployment (if any). These models must be placed within your normal deployment zone.
Heavy warbeasts in Makeda's battlegroup gain +2 SPD during your first turn of the game.

type.models: Paingiver Beast Handlers, Cataphract units, small-based Praetorian units

benefits.ingameeffect: Makeda & the Exalted Court gain Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)
Aptimus Marketh and Ancestral Guardian solos each begin the game with one soul token.
You gain + 1 on your starting roll for the game.

type.models: Paingiver Beast Handlers, Cataphract units, Praetorian units
Agonizer, Void Spirits, Ancestral Guardian solos, Cataphract solos, Extoller solos

benefits.ingameeffect: Friendly models/units can begin the game affected by Hexeris' upkeep spells. These spells and their targets must be declared before either player sets up models. Hexeris does not pay fury to upkeep these spells during your first turn.
Praetorian Swordsmen units gain Advance Deployment
Ancestral Guardian solos in the army gain Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.

type.models: Paingiver Beast Handlers, Praetorian units, Venator units
Agonizer, Void Spirits, Ancestral Guardian solos, Extoller solos

benefits.ingameeffect: For each Extoller solo in the army, one warbeast in Hexeris' battlegroup can use its animus during its activation without being forced. The warbeast cannot be forced to used its animus again that activation.
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.
The warbeast bonded to Hexeris gains Advance Deployment.

type.models: Skorne non-character heavy warbeasts, Molik Karn
Paingiver Beast Handlers, Tyrant Commander & Standard Bearers, Cataphract units, Venator units

benefits.ingameeffect: Venator weapon crews gain Advance Deployment.
Titans in Xerxis' battlegroup gain Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)

type.models: Paingiver Beast Handlers, Skorne units with Shield Wall (Order), Tyrant Commander & Standard Bearer

benefits.ingameeffect: Add up to three Venator Reiver models to any unit with Shield Wall (Order) for 1 point per model. These models are considered to be weapon attachments. These Reiver models do gain the benefits of Shield Wall.
Praetorian Karax units can be deployed anywhere within 20" of the rear table edge of your deployment zone but cannot advance during your first turn.

Friendly models/units can begin the game affected by Xerxis’ upkeep spells. These spells and their targets must be declared before either player sets up models. Xerxis does not pay fury to upkeep these spells during your first turn.

type.models: Paingiver Beast Handlers, Skorne cavalry units, Skorne Tyrant units

benefits.ingameeffect: For each Tyrant model/unit, you can redeploy one model/unit after both players have deployed but before the first player’s first turn. The redeployed models must be placed on the table in a location they could have been deployed initially.
You gain +1 on your starting roll for the game
Siege Animantarax battle engines begin the game with three rage tokens.
Ancestral Guardian solos in this army gain Advance Deployment
Extollers in this army each begin with three soul tokens.
The Kovaas can begin the game in play.

type.models: Paingiver Beast Handlers, Skorne Construct units

benefits.ingameeffect: Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.
Construct solos in the army begin the game with three soul tokens.
Models in this army gain Incorporeal during your first turn of the game.
For every two units, add one Void Spirit solo to the army free of cost. These solos ignore FA restrictions.
Solos with Incorporeal gain Advance Deployment.
Your deployment is extended 2" forward.

type.models: Skorne non-character Basilisk and Titan warbeasts
Cataphract Arcuarii, Paingiver Beast Handlers, Nihilators, Venator units, Minion units that will work for the Skorne

benefits.ingameeffect: One Minion unit gains +2 SPD during your first turn of the game for each Paingiver Task Master solo included .
Agonizer solos each begin the game with 3 fury points
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.

type.models: Skorne non-character warbeasts with SPD 5 or higher

benefits.ingameeffect: Nihilator units gain Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)

Friendly models/units can begin the game affected by Naaresh' upkeep spells. These spells and their targets must be declared before either player sets up models. Naaresh does not pay fury to upkeep these spells during your first turn.
Models in Naaresh's battlegroup gain +2 SPD during your first turn of the game.
